Package eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar

Class Direction

java.lang.Object
eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar.Direction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Direction>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BigIntDirection, IntDirection
public abstract class Direction extends Object implements Comparable<Direction>, Serializable
Abstract class defining functionality of directions in the plane. A Direction is an equivalence class of vectors. Two vectors define the same object of class Direction, if they point into the same direction. We prefer using directions instead of angles, because with angles the arithmetic calculations are in general not exact.
See Also:

    • get_instance

      public static Direction get_instance(Point p_from, Point p_to)
      Calculates the direction from p_from to p_to. If p_from and p_to are equal, null is returned.

    • get_instance_approx

      public static Direction get_instance_approx(double p_angle)
      Creates a Direction whose angle with the x-axis is nearly equal to p_angle

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Direction p_other)
      Returns true, if p_ob is a Direction and this Direction and p_ob point into the same direction

    • side_of

      public Side side_of(Direction p_other)
      Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other.get_vector(). The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this.get_vector() is on the left of L Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this.get_vector() is on the right of L and Side.COLLINEAR, if this.get_vector() is collinear with L.

    • projection

      public Signum projection(Direction p_other)
      The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of of a vector representing this direction and a vector representing p_other is > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.

    • middle_approx

      public Direction middle_approx(Direction p_other)
      calculates an approximation of the direction in the middle of this direction and p_other

    • compare_from

      public int compare_from(Direction p_1, Direction p_2)
      Returns 1, if the angle between p_1 and this direction is bigger the angle between p_2 and this direction, 0, if p_1 is equal to p_2, * and -1 otherwise.

    • angle_approx

      public double angle_approx()
      Returns an approximation of the signed angle corresponding to this dierection.
